reviews.review_msg: She really cares and is very passionate about the course topics. Some people are mad about the final curve but that is just because everyone scored very high on assignments and there needed to be some grade distribution. Not everyone can get an A

I took 419, 310 and 376w with Angelica and she was great for all 3. This class in particular was the most interesting and we were given a lot of space for creativity with the group project. She is passionate about teaching and that translates really well to her lectures. Definitely recommend taking any course she is teaching.
Pretty good Prof, Cares and is thoughtful

Absolutely absurd grading criteria. Like 89+ will be an A-. Bruh. Prof herself is super overrated imo. She wasn't even able to answer challenging questions during the class. The material provided was easy and useless considering this is a 400 lvl course. Overall not too bad but she is just mediocre. Other 419 profs like Nick Vincent is far better.

CMPT376W is not a fun course. We barely learned anything related to writing, and the majority of the focus is on ethics.
As a result, the course becomes "learn how to think in a correct way that won't get you canceled".
In addition to this, she doesn't really have enough office hours. Which means reaching her is difficult.

The professor often struggled to explain the slides. Homework grading was severely delayed, with two weeks of no activity. The final exam had numerous errors requiring multiple corrections. Given the high ratings, I was very disappointed. Take the other professor because you can get a better grade, you have to do self-learning anyway.

The final exam was terrible. Although calculators were allowed, the exam had obscure questions, mistakes, and unclear wording that baffled even the TAs. It felt more like a test of our patience and endurance than of our understanding of the material.

Active answering on Piazza, lectures comprehensive. Exams more convoluted/confusing than necessary, other UD CS & math exams more straightfoward. Midterm: No calculator but had a long calculation w/ decimals. Final exam: Calculator allowed but asked obscure question, mistakes in questions, unclear wording that even TA was confused with when asked.

Angelica's class was decent and I'll cut her some slack since she tried to redo the course with new material. The course contents were pretty much identical to UCB. Overall the lectures were good and exams were fair apart from some final questions. Enjoyed my time in the course.

Garnered a lot of sympathy with performative caring (talks about reading RMP + Discord), but did little to actually help students. Idc that she uses someone else's slides. I do care that she didn't bother learning them first. Her reputation is propped up by her demeanour rather than teaching ability. It's clear she put in minimal effort.

Too much individual assignment weight (only 3 assignments, not enough topic covered) + TAs make them, so can be too hard, also require knowledge outside prerequisites. Lectures had mistakes sometimes, but overall organized selection helpful to introduce AI. Exams feel like trivia, need to memorize names and read textbook (some info not on slides!)
One of those petty instructors who refuses to post notes online because otherwise no one would come to their pointless lectures. This course was a waste of time and she only served to make it worse.

If you just want easier UD credits for grad, this is the course to take. It takes some work to get good grades yes, but you can literally coast (spending 3 hrs max / wk) to class avg. She is nice, but don't expect to get much out of her lectures. All borrowed material including proj (few). Wkly exercise = free marks. Again, EZ UD credits.
Angelica is awesome, you can tell she genuinely wants us to learn about the material
She tells you not to use ChatGPT for your assignments while she copied all her slides form Berkeley without referencing them. What does that tell you?

Dr. Lim presents the course material straightforwardly, and I can tell a lot of thought was put into developing the content. It only includes the relevant parts in a traditionally VERY content-heavy, outdated and boring course. Assignments/tests are graded on understanding- not memorization. Make sure you go over your math fundamentals. Fun class!

Dr. Lim is an excellent professor and I recommend 310 with her. The pre reqs aren't up to date as of now so be sure to have a little calculus and linear algebra but she has helped the class get up to date. Challenging topics so be ready to learn outside of class and use the resources she makes available. Dr. Lim cares about her students success

I'm just entirely amazed at the lazy negative comments for Prof Lim… it makes no sense… you're in CS… at SFU, people. Do you think it's easy? Ignore the negative course feedback if you're actually here to learn.

For serious students who are actual adults: Prof Lim is extremely bright, she's very accessible if you actually ask her questions!

I came here to comment that our midterm for this course was the 29th so take the bad reviews leading up with a grain of salt, great prof imo and makes tough content manageable. We got to do weekly activities in place of an extra lecture and they help me a lot.

Love this class & prof. Content challenging but manageable. Follow lecture examples (versus just re-doing assignments/activities) for exams, my learning. Dr. Lim has entertaining, engaging lectures and integrates topics within the broader picture (industry, current research). Huge course, good to be familiar with topics.10/10 recommend.

The recent comments about Dr. Lim's instruction in CMPT 310 have been rather harsh. Dr. Lim has great expertise & is doing her best in taking a traditionally difficult/confusing course, and delivering it to us with modernity, clarity, and depth. She's clear, approachable, provides relevant resources. If you're taking 310, she is a solid choice.

The professor is kind and genuinely passionate about the subject, but she struggles to teach effectively. In one class, students had to explain content from her own slides to her. The slides themselves are taken from Berkeley/Stanford, and she often comes unprepared for lectures.

Seems like a nice person, but her 310 class is definitely not good. She can't explain the slides well (as they are copied from Stanford/Berkely), and attending lecture becomes essentially useless. 100% of my learning in this course has been from Youtube.

I was excited to take 310 with Angelica after seeing all her great reviews. She copies all her course materials from Stanford and Berkeley and does not know what she's talking about. She does not prepare for lectures and all her materials (including the ridiculous assignments) are made by the TAs. She only gets by with her "nice" personality.

Professor Lim is one of my favourite professors I've encountered at SFU. Assignments were a lot of work but taught you a lot. Exams were difficult but fair. Final project was great. She really cares about her students and is very approachable outside of class if you need any help. You can tell she's passionate about her work. 10/10 highly recommend
Angelica is a solid pick for 376. Fair exams and good delivery. No complaints here.

She's one of the best instructors in the computer science department.
I felt lectures were much more tolerated with her.
Will definitely take every course possible with her

Hearing Angelica lecture is such a pleasure, she clearly has so much passion for her subject and for getting people interested in programming! I would take any class she took, she really prioritizes explaining complex topics in relatable ways we can understand. Come to class because her code-along activities help you really learn and REMEMBER it!

If you have a chance to take a class with Dr. Lim, TAKE IT! CMPT120 is pretty easy in the first place, but that's only because Angelica makes learning so easy and enjoyable. She explains concepts clearly and codes examples in class, and is very approachable for office hours. Assignments and exams were very fair. Overall amazing prof.
Best professor hands down. I would take classes in the future that she teaches just to have her again.

Solid professor. The only thing I would wish for would be video recordings of the lectures as certain topics could use some clarification. 80% of your grade is split between the midterm, final exam and a coding project, so make sure to take those seriously.

Great teacher, lots of Python in class coding so do your reading before lectures. Test heavy, as 60% of your grade came from them but their difficulty is fair. Make sure you start weekly assignments and the final projects EARLY. I would've gotten an A in the course, but I bombed the final project because I procrastinated hard (14/60 lmao).

Dr.Lim is one of the best profs! She is so caring about her students and genuinely wants the best for you to succeed. All her lectures were well explained and she was always open to questions. Go to office hours, even if you have no questions. The course itself is not hard for beginners and the midterms and final were fair. Would recommend 100%

Honestly wonder if a better prof than Dr Lim exists at sfu. So caring and sweet, you'll like the class even if you're not a CS major. Explanations are done well enough that you don't need to read the online textbook but if you choose to, it's in full understandable detail and it's quick to read.

Great prof! She made programming enjoyable and l looked forward to attending each lecture. Her slides and audio recordings are always posted on Canvas, so anyone who misses a class can catch up. Assignments are also super fun!

Angelica Lim is an amazing professor, she is very clear and thorough with her explanations. The issue is the final exams and midterms for this course, which Angelica doesn't create. They're very far off from the class material and mock midterms given before each examination. Have a background in coding for this course, it is not beginner friendly.
Great and energetic prof. Very organized and lectures were easy to follow.

She is a very good professor and made programming very fun. Her lecture materials were very relevant to the weekly coding exercises but she wasn't very helpful when you ask her about content on the midterm since she doesn't make them. CMPT120 is very beginner-friendly but having any prior programming experience in the past will be helpful.

The most interesting elective I've taken but also the hardest (I had no coding experience). An intro class but I found it very hard to grasp the concepts. Assignments were helpful for learning but they also took longer than expected (5-10hrs). Angelica was very helpful and nice but lectures can be confusing at times. Tests were extremely difficult.

Very good prof! Teaches concepts very clearly, tries to make it easy for beginners, and is overall a very caring person. Make sure to read the assigned readings before class, as that helps you understand the lecture's topics better.

Very nice/understanding professor who's always available for help outside of class however her lectures were very different from assignments and midterms/finals. Also, she gave mock exams to prepare us but those did not reflect the difficulty of the actual exams whatsoever. Office hours with the TAs also sucked and were waste of time.

Never taken programming before but made it super manageable for me, used great metaphors, had a great time in all lectures. Would definitely take both class and prof again. Did a great job at accommodating students and answering programming/general questions. Super sweet.

She's really nice and makes an effort to teach at our level. One thing to be wary of are the tests as they don't 100% reflect what she teaches or assignments in terms of how hard they are. Otherwise, pretty solid. Oh and read the readings for sure.

Angelica Lim is an excellent prof no doubt! The class was really fun in terms of assignments but the examinations were extremely difficult. They provided mock exams yet the real exams didn't even reflect 1% of it. I wish they had provided better exams that actually reflected the level of difficulty we were used to and what they prepped us for.

honestly she's a rly nice prof. the class starts off relatively easy (at least for me) but rly gets challenging after the first midterm so make sure u start grinding lol. the TAs for my section were kinda unhelpful tbh but the prof has pretty good office hours and answered all my questions
Really great professor, everything is organized so well especially the readings. Excellent lectures and easy grading for assignments. Tests are pretty hard though. 100% would recommend.

Angelica is a great prof, 120 is a hard class but she made it a lot more easier to understand. Midterm was harder than I thought and nearly nothing similar to the mock she gave to us. Also some of the weekly assignments will took a long time to finish.
really good prof, wants to help her students. her weekly assignments are a bit tough, but not too bad. exams were pretty hard tho

Angelica really pulled through with office hours after each lecture to try and answer everyones questions. She tries to make it as easy as possible to get you to follow along in class, lectures are fun(for what compsci classes can be lol) and her tests are reflective of her assignments. Take her class - best prof in the program.

By far best prof and maybe teacher I've ever had. Super understanding, caring and knowledgeable. Some course work is challenging for new programmers like myself however very doable. As it was online, the course was done through canvas and it was the most organized and nice formatting I have ever seen. Also free textbook recourses so that's a plus.

A caring prof. Materials are conveyed well. Weekly homework 100% sets you up for mid term. I recommend watching the 4 hours Python video on YouTube, which covers over half of the entire CMPT120 course. She is how all profs should be like.

Was hesitant to take this class as I had no coding experience but Angelica is the ideal prof for an intro to coding. Lectures are done at a very manageable pace and you never feel overwhelmed afterwards. Keeping up with weekly practice is absolutely necessary to do well. If you can can do the assignments in a reasonable time, you will get an A
She was my best prof so far I loved the class with her. She also explained really well so if you listen well you don't have to read too much. Take a class with her without any second mind.
She's good at explaining concepts, especially for beginner coders.
No complaints here. She was nice and seemed to use feedback to adjust the course based on how the class doing. Overall, would take a class with her again.

Professor Lim is hands-down one of the best teachers I have had so far in my life. She is caring, adds humor when teaching, goes over examples well, and even shows real-life applications for what we can do with computer science. If you are looking to learn more about computer science or want to get involved with it, look no further than this prof.

A very sweet professor who cares about her students. I had 0 programming background before taking this course and now I know all of the basic fundamentals of coding. Easy class if you pay attention and attend lectures.

Inspirational. Dr. Lim really teaches you in way that is approachable and gives confidence in CS. I didn't have much experience with computers before her class but I learned so much, and enjoyed it so much that I have switched to Data Science major. Grading and work were very fair. If you have the ability to take her class do not hesitate.

Angelica is the best professor I've ever had at SFU. She cared about the course so much and was just an absolute pleasure to be taught by her. The course material is incredibly accessible and engaging. I will drop everything to take another class with Angelica. Do yourself a favour and take any class with Angelica.

Angelica is a sweet prof. You can tell that she is really passionate about computing sciences. I had no prior programming experience, and I definitely found the material challenging at times, but Angelica taught at a fair pace. I recommend reviewing the exam banks as many of the same questions appeared on her exams.

Funny, caring, and kind. A good prof and a great person. She makes classes fun and engaging. You actually feel like you learn alongside her, as she is very humble. Exams can vary in difficulty, but are manageable.

Angelica was the best professor I had in my 3 years of Uni. I only took CMPT because I was interested in the topic, with no previous programming knowledge. Her lectures are clear, her tests tricky but fair and she is very approachable outside of lectures. Highly recommend
She is the nicest prof I 've met. Even if you don't understand any concept, at any point in the semester, she will take her time and go out of her way to explain it to you. Very very sweet. 10/10

The professor is very nice and informative, even though i have no background of coding and never went to the lab to ask for help. I could still learnt alot from Dr Lim, just by attend the lecture(it is extremely helpful). The exams are not too hard, but some of them maybe tricky. However, if you pay enough effort, it will be a gpa booster.

Dr. Angelica is nice and very sweet, though her exams are quite difficult, specifically her coding questions. Although there are only 2 questions, I've heavily been relying on my cheat sheet to SOMEHOW get a code that at least consists of some of the python elements for both midterms. TERRIFIED FOR FINAL BC NO CHEAT SHEET.
Dr. Lim is truly a sweetheart and that is prevalent in her lectures. You can see that she does anything and everything in her power for her students to understand the lecture material.
Her class are very fair and very doable to get a good grade. She is a sweet lady, but don't let it fool you because her quiz and exam are not easy. Make sure you study all of her notes very well.
Super nice and a lovely prof. Her lectures are a bit stale, but she teaches with enthusiasm. Would not mind if she taught all my courses.

She seems nice, lectures are well done. However I can't say much because I really haven't learned a thing from this course and I think that is more because of the curriculum. She organized it and executed it well for what the course is. Has potential to be a good teacher for sure. Pre-study java and android a bit before taking this ;) it helps.

One of the best professors I have ever taken for a course at SFU. She is very passionate about what she teaches and is also a very kind and inspirational person. If you have a chance to take one of her courses, do it.

She's a decent 1st time prof with good explanations. She posts everything and records lectures so that's no need to attend but you should. Homework was free marks but her exams had hard MCQ and she didn't allow a cheatsheet in the final so memorize your syntax! My other complaint was she only had 1 office hour per week but she helped after class.

She encourages everyone to bring their laptops to code along with her during lectures, so you actually leave each lecture having learned something. She made this course really enjoyable, especially for those of us who had no prior computer science experience
Angelica is super sweet and patient. I love her lectures and I did learn something in her class!
Angelica is a really nice prof. You can tell that she is very passionate about computing science. She even gave us cookies on the first day. All of us.
